name: Weaponising glamour
description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

key_work.title: Weaponising glamour
key_work.last_on_display_place: Australian Centre for the Moving Image
key_work.brief_description: When she performed in a risqué skirt of bananas and a beaded necklace in Paris, Josephine Baker became a symbol of the Jazz Age flapper. Her provocative costumes and distinct dancing made her a fashion icon and she was the first African American to lead a feature film, Sirens of the Tropics.

constellations_primary.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_primary.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

Her provocative costumes and distinct dancing made her a fashion icon and she was the first African American to lead a feature film, Sirens of the Tropics.

end.title: Dutch in Seven Lessons
end.creator_credit: Charles Huguenot van der Linden, Heinz Josephson, Rita Roland, George Julsing, Harold Goodwin, Jack Dudok van Heel and Dutch Independent
end.brief_description: A film-within-the-film scenario involving a cameraman who’s given a week to photograph the aerial highlights of Holland for a travelogue.

constellations_other.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_other.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

links.description: Three years after WWII ended, Audrey Hepburn made her film debut in this film. Years before, she ran messages to Dutch Resistance fighters. Instead of relying on her fame like Baker, Hepburn’s youth helped her unsuspected.

start.title: The Dating Game
start.brief_description: The Dating Game is an ABC television show that first aired on December 20, 1965 and was the first of many shows created and packaged by Chuck Barris from the 1960s through the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_other.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

end.title: Confessions of a Dangerous Mind
end.creator_credit: George Clooney, Renée April, Stephen Mirrione, Andrew Lazar, Allied Filmmakers, Mad Chance, Miramax, James D. Bissell and Charlie Kaufman
end.brief_description: TV made him famous, but his biggest hits happened off screen. TV producer by day, CIA assassin by night, Chuck Barris was recruited by the CIA at the height of his TV career… or was he.

constellations_other.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_other.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

links.description: Barris’ secret life was the subject of the George Clooney film Confessions of a Dangerous Mind.

start.title: Ecstasy = Ekstase
start.brief_description: This controversial Czech film, featuring a very young Hedy Lamarr, gained international notoriety for its loose morals and a lengthy nude sequence. It was banned in America, Britain and Germany.

end.title: Bombshell: The Hedy Lamarr Story
end.creator_credit: Alexandra Dean, Lindy Jankura, Penelope Falk, Adam Haggiag, Julie Sacks, Katherine Drew and Reframed Pictures

video_links.name: Bombshell - The Hedy Lamarr Story - Official Trailer

end.brief_description: The life and career of the hailed Hollywood movie star and underappreciated genius inventor, Hedy Lamarr.

constellations_other.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_other.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

links.description: The story of Hedy Lamarr and her inventions was explored recently in the 2018 biographical documentary film , Bombshell: The Hedy Lamarr Story.

end.brief_description: This controversial Czech film, featuring a very young Hedy Lamarr, gained international notoriety for its loose morals and a lengthy nude sequence. It was banned in America, Britain and Germany.

constellations_other.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_other.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

links.description: While a teen, at 18, Hedy Lamarr starred in the controversial film Ecstasy, which she later disavowed. During WW II, she developed a technology that was designed to prevent the jamming of torpedoes by enemy ships and was predecessor of wifi.

end.title: The French Chef
end.creator_credit: David Atwood, Russell Fortier, Ruth Lockwood and WGBH Boston
end.brief_description: The French Chef is a television cooking show created and hosted by Julia Child. The show grew out of some special presentations that Child did based on the book Mastering the Art of French Cooking.

constellations_other.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_other.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

links.description: Before Julia Child became one of the first celebrity chefs, Child worked at the Office of Strategic Services (OSS), a precursor to the CIA. She was asked to help develop a repellent to prevent sea creatures from setting off underwater bombs targeting German U-Boats.

start.title: The French Chef
start.creator_credit: David Atwood, Russell Fortier, Ruth Lockwood and WGBH Boston
start.brief_description: The French Chef is a television cooking show created and hosted by Julia Child. The show grew out of some special presentations that Child did based on the book Mastering the Art of French Cooking.

end.title: The Dating Game
end.brief_description: The Dating Game is an ABC television show that first aired on December 20, 1965 and was the first of many shows created and packaged by Chuck Barris from the 1960s through the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Weaponising glamour
constellations_other.description: Josephine Baker wasn't just a star, she was a spy with the French Resistance during the German occupation of France during WWII. She wasn't the only celebrity to weaponise her glamour.

links.description: Two years after The French Chef debuted, game-show host Chuck Barris appeared on The Dating Game. In his autobiography, Barris claimed to have been a CIA spy who assassinated Soviet agents… which he later claimed was imaginary.
